name: NSCollectionViewDiffableDataSourceReference
desc: The Swift representation of the Objective-C object you use to manage data and provide items for a collection view.

items.name: init(collectionView: NSCollectionView, itemProvider: NSCollectionViewDiffableDataSourceReferenceItemProvider)
items.desc: Creates a diffable data source with the specified item provider, and connects it to the specified collection view.

items.name: typealias NSCollectionViewDiffableDataSourceReferenceItemProvider
items.desc: A closure that configures and returns an item for a collection view from its diffable data source.

items.name: var supplementaryViewProvider: NSCollectionViewDiffableDataSourceReferenceSupplementaryViewProvider?
items.desc: The closure that configures and returns the collection view’s supplementary views, such as headers and footers, from the diffable data source.

items.name: typealias NSCollectionViewDiffableDataSourceReferenceSupplementaryViewProvider
items.desc: A closure that configures and returns a collection view’s supplementary view, such as a header or footer, from a diffable data source.

items.name: func itemIdentifier(for: IndexPath) -> Any?
items.desc: Returns an identifier for the item at the specified index path in the collection view.

items.name: func indexPath(forItemIdentifier: Any) -> IndexPath?
items.desc: Returns an index path for the item with the specified identifier in the collection view.

items.name: func snapshot() -> NSDiffableDataSourceSnapshotReference
items.desc: Returns a representation of the current state of the data in the collection view.

items.name: func applySnapshot(NSDiffableDataSourceSnapshotReference, animatingDifferences: Bool)
items.desc: Updates the UI to reflect the state of the data in the specified snapshot, optionally animating the UI changes.
